content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems like a fun puzzle to try some optimization on :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is Spring. It is daisies and tulips' season. The graphic interface is great. The game seems simple, but in fact...

- Would be nice if you can write above the money bag on how much gold was added to the player on a round of harvest or negative if it was only placing.
- Add 1 league with a boss doing something slightly smart, to make it more interesting to submit higher up.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The last message in the description.　^_^

Another suggestion: if you know how to catch a program page fault or any langage exception, do display the information instead of just "timeout". I personally have the same problem on my TwixtPP contribution.

- Tooltips would be nice
- I recommend using the EndScreen module to get the standard end screen
- Player images helps keep track of players. Far easier to recognise in addition to nickname
- Invalid action shown as tooltip instead of information about the loss of no gold left
- Money gained is a little bit to fast. Let the flower grow out fully before removing them. ( the animation )

Looks like a nice game :)

Nice. I hope some other players will join so that we can test a little bit more.

Got a little confused by the description of the Harvesting flowers algorithm:
> for each direction (north - south, east - west, northeast - southwest and northwest - southeast)
>
>   count the number of adjacent flowers starting  * from the flower just planted *
>    if the number of adjacent flowers  *in this direction* is larger or equal to 4, all adjacent flowers in this direction are harvested.

It is not what is done. If you put an X in the middle of XX.X it is harvested though according to the rules it should not.

Hello, thank you for taking the time to look at my contribution. I am glad you like it.  

I've updated the statement, I admit it was unclear. 

I know It's competition time, so I guess most people are writing their submarine bots, but I hope for more testers of my multi too.
Thanks for the comments, I will do the recommended updates.

Thank you for the suggestion. I am displaying the error in tooltip and in game output. The display is different for four cases: timeout, invalid location (provided 2 integers out of the map), out of gold (player can not afford playing the flower) and invalid action (i.e. did not provide 2 integers).
Thanks for approving, and for the comment, :)
Ok, both good ideas. I'll implement them and get back to you.
Thanks for approving, it is spring indeed, the flowers are blooming and winning strategy is yet to be discovered.
Thank you for approving and for all the comments you gave during the revision process. They really made the final game significantly better.
I think the boss should be able to beat my current submit as it is hardcoded positions.

I implemented the display "Change in Gold" (red for negative, white for positive) and added the second league. The Boss beats your hardcorded implementation by looking one step ahead. It is the same as my current submit. The level 2 boss just plays randomly. I did not publish the boss code on github. 

Do you know how to change the boss's name? Now, it says "Boss 1," and I can't figure out where the name comes from.
Don't think you can

Maybe swap the colors of the players too?
As the Red player has the white flow with yellow in the center and the orange player has the red/pink flower
Done!

The following modifications were done:
- added tooltips when player gets gold
- added tooltips for invalid action, out of gold and invalid location errors
- replaced the end game screen with standard EndScree  module end screen
- added player images to screen
- reworked the timing of the harvesting animations.
Tooltips on the map itself would be nice too. To be able to hover and see the X and Y values.
And gold tooltips are a little too much I think. Was talking about the X and Y :)
The tooltips on the field are a great idea, thanks! Done! I also remove the earned gold tooltips as suggested.

Allow players to print message too?
Where you write: I love tulips.
Is a nice place to print some personal stats.
Output:
X Y Here comes my message
(and cap the message to some width.)

Did you set MaxWidth on the player name Text btw? To not make it overflow the sign.

Yes, messages are allowed, text after location in the output is displayed. The explanation is in the statement. After your suggestion, I limited the displayed text to 25 chars, also, I limited the player nickname to 15 chars. Looking at the ocean-of-code leaderboard, it seems most people have nick shorter than that, so I should be ok.

int m = min(player.getNicknameToken().length(),15);
        String playerNick = player.getNicknameToken().substring(0,m);

        graphicEntityModule.createText(playerNick)

getNicknameToken() is always $1 or something and is replaced in the View itself. So this never becomes too long.
You have to use: .setMaxWidth(N)

From ocean of code:
Text nickname = entityManager.createText(player.getNicknameToken())
                .setFontFamily("Arial")
                .setX(1080/4)
                .setY(270)
                .setZIndex(20)
                .setAnchorX(0.5)
                .setMaxWidth(400)
                .setFontSize(60)
                .setFillColor(player.getColorToken());
I see, it even displays three dots, if the name is too long. Thank you for explaining. It's updated.
